Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Feeble-minded \Fee"ble-mind"ed\, a. Weak in intellectual power; wanting firmness or constancy; irresolute; vacillating; imbecile. ``comfort the feeble-minded.'' --1 Thess. v. 14. -- {Fee"ble-mind"ed*ness}, n. [1913 Webster]
feebleminded adj 1: retarded in intellectual development [syn: {backward}] 2: mentally deficient [syn: {half-witted}, {slow-witted}]
